intro: Oldenlandia paniculata var. pygmaea, commonly known as the dwarf spiderwort, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that typically bloom in clusters, often in shades of white or pale blue. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories or along stream banks. Its foliage is generally heart-shaped with a glossy texture, contributing to its ornamental value in gardens.
